revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | name = Rhea Butcher | image = Rhea_Butcher.jpg | alt = Rhea Butcher speaking into a microphone. They are caucasian, are wearing a brown hat and white shirt, and facing to the right. | caption = Butcher at [[w00tstock]] 8.0 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|8|12}} | birth_place = [[Akron, Ohio]], U.S. | children = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Cameron Esposito]]
|2015|2018|reason={{abbr|sep.|separated}}}} | medium = Stand-up, television, radio, internet | active = 2012â€“present | genre = | subject = | notable_work = ''[[Take My Wife (2016 TV series)|Take My Wife]]'' | signature = | website = {{url|http://RheaButcher.com}} | module = }} '''Rhea Butcher''' (born August 12, 1982) is an American [[stand-up comic]], actor, writer, producer, and podcast host.{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/RheaButcher/about/?entry_point=page_nav_about_item&tab=page_info|title=Rhea Butcher - About - Facebook|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2016}} They are best known for their personal, observational comedy focused on their [[vegetarianism]], [[feminism]], love of [[baseball]], and experiences as a [[butch lesbian]].{{cite web|url=http://thelaughbutton.com/albums/rhea-butcher-lays-butcher/|title=Rhea Butcher lays down all that they are and more on "Butcher" -|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2016}} Butcher uses they/them pronouns. Originally from [[Akron]], Butcher now resides in [[Los Angeles]] with their wife and fellow comic [[Cameron Esposito]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/simonthompson/2016/08/11/cameron-esposito-and-rhea-butcher-talk-take-my-wife-paul-feig-and-the-heyday-for-female-comedians/2/#4ee41471d470|title=Cameron Esposito And Rhea Butcher Talk 'Take My Wife', Paul Feig And The Heyday For Female Comedians|last=Thompson|first=Simon|work=Forbes|access-date=2017-05-31}} == Early life == Butcher was raised in the Kenmore neighborhood of Akron, Ohio.{{Cite news|url=http://wksu.org/post/comedian-rhea-butcher-keeps-akron-heart-her-success#stream/0|title=Comedian Rhea Butcher Keeps Akron at the Heart of Her Success|last=Rabinowitz|first=Amanda|access-date=2017-05-31|language=en}} They are an only child; their parents divorced when they were one month old.{{Cite news|url=https://clevelandmagazine.com/entertainment/film-tv/articles/comedian-rhea-butcher-is-the-real-deal|title=Comedian Rhea Butcher is the Real Deal|access-date=2017-05-31|language=en}} They graduated from the [[University of Akron]] with a degree in printmaking. == Personal life == On December 12, 2015, Butcher married comedian [[Cameron Esposito]] onstage at [[The Hideout Inn|The Hideout]] in Esposito's hometown of [[Chicago, Illinois]].{{cite web|url=https://www.chicagoreader.com/Bleader/archives/2016/08/17/two-wives-are-better-than-one-on-take-my-wife |title=Two wives are better than one on ''Take My Wife'' |last=Wellen|first=Brianna|date=17 August 2016|publisher=[[The Chicago Reader]] |accessdate=31 January 2018}} Butcher is [[non-binary]]{{cite web|url=http://www.sheknows.com/entertainment/articles/1132248/rhea-butcher-things-to-know |title=Get to Know Nonbinary Comedian Rhea Butcher & Her Other Political Beliefs |last=Long|first=Sarah|date=24 February 2017|publisher= |accessdate=31 January 2018}} and uses they/them pronouns.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bustle.com/p/as-a-genderqueer-person-i-believe-visibility-is-our-greatest-weapon-against-hate-in-2017-41645|title=Seeing The Positive In The Future Of Trans Rights|last=Butcher|first=Rhea|work=Bustle|accessdate=2018-02-16}}{{Cite news|url=https://twitter.com/RheaButcher/status/979792359096553477|title=Rhea Butcher ðŸ‡µðŸ‡· on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=2018-04-01|language=en}} In August 2018, Butcher and Esposito announced their separation to "live individual lives." {{Cite news|url=https://twitter.com/RheaButcher/status/1027242599810125824|title=rhea butcher on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=2018-08-08|language=en}} == Early career == Butcher began their comedy career performing improv in Chicago at [[The Second City]] and has since performed stand-up at clubs including Zanies, the Jukebox, and Flappers, as well as Chicago Underground Comedy, The Hideout, The Lincoln Lodge, UCB, Cole's, and Meltdown.{{cite web|url=http://www.kcrw.com/people/rhea-butcher|title=Rhea Butcher|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2016}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.vulture.com/2016/08/cameron-esposito-rhea-butcher-on-take-my-wife.html|title=Cameron Esposito and Rhea Butcher on Take My Wife, â€˜The Show Where Lesbians Donâ€™t Dieâ€™|work=Vulture|access-date=2017-05-31|language=en}} They made their late night debut on ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' in June 2016.{{cite web|url=http://teamcoco.com/video/rhea-butcher-06-30-16|title=Rhea Butcher Stand-Up 06/30/16|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2016}} == 2014â€“present == In the fall of 2014, Butcher appeared alongside Esposito in a series of videos for [[BuzzFeed]] Motion Pictures titled "Ask a Lesbian."Habersburger, Keith. [https://www.buzzfeed.com/keithhabersberger/ask-a-lesbian-with-cameron-esposito#.va9VV4bKdZ "Questions You Wish You Could Ask a Lesbian"]. BuzzFeed.com, October 31, 2014.Star, Erika. [http://www.afterellen.com/general-news/105780-lez-stand-out-rhea-butcher-and-cameron-esposito "Lez Stand Out: Rhea Butcher and Cameron Esposito"]. AfterEllen.com, February 20, 2013. The pair was also tapped to co-host the web series "She Said" for [[Amy Poehler's Smart Girls]] Network.{{cite web|url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/keelyflaherty/a-new-web-series-for-ladies|title=Amy Poehler's Made A New Web Series For Women|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2016}} They wrote and starred together again in ''[[Take My Wife (2016 TV series)|Take My Wife]],'' on the comedy streaming service [[Seeso]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/24/arts/television/comedy-television-im-dying-up-here-louie-maron.html|title=Have You Heard the One About the Angsty Comic? Yes, Too Often|last=Poniewozik|first=James|date=2017-05-24|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-05-31|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/feature/nbc-out/take-my-wife-honest-comedy-where-lesbians-live-n638056|title=Cameron Esposito, Rhea Butcher Talk Comedy, Diversity and 'Take My Wife'|work=NBC News|access-date=2017-05-31|language=en}} Butcher also co-hosts the stand-up comedy podcast "Put Your Hands Together" with Cameron Esposito, which is recorded weekly in front of a live audience at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theater in Los Angeles.https://losangeles.ucbtheatre.com/show/3347 Butcher's first comedy album ''Butcher'' was released in August 2016 by the independent record label [[Kill Rock Stars]].{{cite web|url=http://www.killrockstars.com/news/Rhea-Butcher|title=News|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2016}} The set was performed at [[Mississippi Studios]] in [[Portland, Oregon]].{{cite web|url=http://www.portlandmercury.com/portland/rhea-butcher-is-killing-it/Content?oid=17366298|title=Rhea Butcher Is Killing It|first=Rebecca|last=Waits|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2016}} It debuted at number one on [[ITunes Store|iTunes]]. == Notable appearances == {| class="wikitable" |- ! Title !! Medium !! Role !! Year |- | ''Put Your Hands Together'' || Podcast || Host || 2013â€“present |- | ''Wham Bam Pow'' || Podcast || Host || 2013â€“2015 |- | ''She Said'' || Web Video Series || Host || 2015 |- | ''[[Bajillion Dollar Propertie$]]'' || Television || Jamie || 2016 |- | ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' || Television || Guest || 2016 |- | ''[[Take My Wife (2016 TV series)|Take My Wife]]''{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/07/19/take-my-wife-trailer-cameron-esposito-rhea-butcher|title=Cameron Esposito promises 'no lesbians die' in new show 'Take My Wife'|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2016}} || Television || Rhea || 2016â€“present |- | ''[[Adam Ruins Everything]]'' || Television || Rhea Conover || 2016 |- | ''[[The Meltdown with Jonah and Kumail]]'' || Television || Guest || 2016 |- |''[[HarmonQuest]]'' |Television |Guest |2016â€“present |- |''Queery'' |Podcast |Guest |2018â€“present |- |''[[Good Mythical Morning]]'' |YouTube |Guest |2018 |- |''Three Swings'' |Podcast |Host |2018â€“present |} == References == {{reflist|2}} == External links == *{{official website|http://rheabutcher.com}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Butcher, Rhea}} [[Category:LGBT comedians]] [[Category:American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:Lesbian actresses]] [[Category:Actresses from Akron, Ohio]] [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American comedians]] [[Category:LGBT entertainers from the United States]] [[Category:LGBT people from Ohio]] [[Category:21st-century American actresses]] [[Category:Feminist comedians]] [[Category:People with non-binary gender identities]]
